website_summaries.verdict: The MagniVisor Deluxe’s multiple magnification lenses, comfort-fit headband, and flexible LED light easily make this a top-tier headband magnifier.
pros: Removable LED light with magnetic base
cons: A rechargeable internal battery would have been preferable

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk.
customer_reviews.text: The lenses are very cheap, and when you try to flip them up out of the way the lense comes out in your hand. The light attachment is only held in by a taper in the cavity in the headset, and not a snap in mechanism. I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: craig clark

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value
customer_reviews.text: For $30, I did not expect much. However, this is a much higher quality products than what you would expect for something in this price range. My wife is a dentist, and has one of those $1000 + loupe, and when I let her try it on, she could not believe how good this compared to her professional dental loupe. She even argued with me about why I would need something like this, thinking it was a couple hundred dollars. When I told her how much it cost, no more argument, Highly recommend . This is one of those product that I feel I got every penny's worth .
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: A very nice magnifier
customer_reviews.text: This magnifier works very well. It allows me to work close-up without having to look through the lower part of my bifocals, so it's great for soldering electronics, working with small yarn, or small painting jobs. The LEDs provide a good bright light that's very adjustable. The interchangeable lenses snap firmly into the bracket, no worries about the lens moving ntil you want it to move. I'd prefer a different texture and perhaps a cloth sleeve on the forehead strap, but that's a minor nitpick. Size adjustment is easy and I had no problem making it fit my large head.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre Quality, Forehead Pinching Headband, don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: My first one came with a broken magnifier and I returned it, but within two months while using it, the magnifier part fell out of the headset, and shattered the connector off just like the one that was damaged in the box that I returned. The headband is very pinch-y across the forehead. While it fit my giant noggin any movement of the headband would result in that outer band scratching your forehead, so any adjustment while working and you get a nice sharp scratch across the forehead, not enough to bleed but enough to get your attention. Guess I'll be looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Cranky Old Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Lumps on the headband
customer_reviews.text: One problem has developed which causes me to give a three star rating. The white plastic part of the headband that fits around the forehead has developed four vertical humps about 1/4 inch wide, 1 inch high ( the width of the band), and protruding about 1/8 inch from the otherwise smooth, flat surface. This is apparently caused from expansion of the plastic material from body temperature. However, the humps do not go away when the headlamp is not in use. These humps create some discomfort when wearing the magnifying headlamp for extended periods.
customer_reviews.author: chief jd

customer_reviews.title: Works great, worried about lenses
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about it except that I am worried about changing lenses. It requires a lot of force to remove a lens from the head frame. It requires so much force that I am afraid that I am going to break the head frame, the lens, or both. Not to mention that you get your greasy hands all over the lens while attempting to remove it. The head band is a little clumsy to adjust. Magnification is incredible. Lighting is brilliant. Weight is comfortable. You can perform surgery on a flea with this thing.
customer_reviews.author: LE

customer_reviews.title: An essential tool!
customer_reviews.text: Owned for two years and I simply can't say enough about how well I like this magnifier. On my size setting it has NEVER fallen off. It is easy to wear over normal glasses and the flip-up lens works well to return to normal vision. The lens selection is good but I find the 1.5 and 2x are great for most work. The large size of the lens gives good periferal vision without the "tunnel" effect,and they are easy to clean. Even the box is great for storing the set and keeping it clean. A supurb value.
customer_reviews.author: Downeasta

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to wear, bright light, many different strengths of magnification. My only beef with the product is that the fit between the head unit and the magnification lenses is very tenuous. If you inadvertently push up on the lens, itself, (that is attached to the drop-down visor) in an attempt to raise the visor, the lens may pop out and hit the floor. The connection between the lenses and the visor needs to be more secure. Other than that issue, this is an indispensable tool for modelers.
customer_reviews.author: Edward S. Matisoff

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for $30 I shouldn't expect too much?
customer_reviews.text: The visor is well packaged and it provides reasonably good magnification. But the build quality is very cheap. Every part is made cheaply but the one that bothers me the most is the retaining features used to snap the lenses into place. You don't get a solid click when the lens seats and a couple times the lens fell out. This is probably an appropriate product for someone who rarely needs to use it. For frequent or professional work, a better tool is probably in order.
customer_reviews.author: GrittyLilFremont

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: 1. lenses are very hard to snap in and really hard to remove, had to use a prying tool (screwdriver) to remove. I thought the mount was going to break first but the lens finally snapped out. Certainly nowhere as easy as the direction say it is. They must get many back with broken hinges for the lens mount. 2. The headband is not comfortable, maybe foam in the front like Mageyes would help. 3. The LED light has a blue color instead of white like LED'd use to have 20 years ago. 4. Not unusable, but unlikable.
customer_reviews.author: jabnolimit

customer_reviews.title: Magnification and Light All In One
customer_reviews.text: The Carson Magnifier Deluxe CP-60 solved a problem for me of having both magnification and light while working on small parts. Holding a flashlight and looking through a loupe was just not working any more. This is a good product for the money, well-made and nicely packaged. And Carson's customer service is very responsive. After I accidentally broke a tab on one of the lenses when trying to remove it, I called the customer service number on the web site, and a new lens was immediately sent to me at no charge. My original rating on this was 4 stars, but I have upgraded to 5 stars after continuing to use the product.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Superior and highly recommended visor
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic product this is! I am a photorealistic pencil artist and my focus is detail. For Me, I can't draw it if I can't see it. With the different choices of lenses, the option to use a bright LED head lamp, it's a perfect solution. The visor itself is lightweight and adjustable. The lenses easily fit over my prescription transitional glasses and if I need to look away from my drawing for any reason, I simply flip up the lenses rather than taking the whole visor off. I cannot recommend this product highly enough and will be purchasing another as backup so I will never be without one.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle M.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for Me
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble with my eyes tearing up and burning, but when I started using the MagniVisor to assist my vision while sorting my stamps and do my recreational reading I had no more problems. I've had no problems with the MagniVisor. I can easily read those old books with the small print. I would buy this item again in a heart beat. They've made late night reading easy, now.
customer_reviews.author: BIG BEAR

customer_reviews.title: Embroidering Again!
customer_reviews.text: I've not been able to cross stitch for years - couldn't see the 35 count linen clearly enough. These have solved the problem, and I don't even need the highest magnification lens. The lens goes in front of my glasses, and the light shines right where I need it to be. My only complaint is that the headband is hard plastic and that gets uncomfortable after a while. I may try what another reviewer said and put the soft side of a Velcro band on it, see how that does. I was a bit worried as I thought I'd have to get very high-end professional level, but this is working nicely.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: These are the best magnifying visors around!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. We now have them at every station in our Lice Clinics of America. They make doing a lice head check a breeze. Having the different lenses along with the light makes the job easy for everyone. I couldn't do my work without them. They stay in place great. I tried several different visors before falling in love with this one. They are on and off my head multiple times a day and still look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: ItsLiz

customer_reviews.title: Great value without complaints
customer_reviews.text: Just got it, and so far it seems like a great value. Some have complained of the lamp pressing against their forehead. My guess it depends on the size and shape of your head. I like this device well enough to modify it a bit if it becomes uncomfortable. The lenses and light work well for me. The box needs a rubber band to keep it shut—minor inconvenience. A case for the head land set would be nice even if it was separate for another $12. It’s worth a try if you need a hands-free way to magnify and light up things to see.
customer_reviews.author: Pine Breeze

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of lens for various tasks
customer_reviews.text: Don't listen to the reviewers that say their lens keep falling out. You have to snap them in with a bit of force. There is a kind of click when you first put them in that could confuse you that you have put them in correctly and it will hold lightly. If you don't push past this initial click they will fall out, if you do push the lens in all the way, there is no way they can fall out. Very solid. I like that the light is removable, I can use a stand to hold the light for me which makes the lens set lighter to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: best of three brands
customer_reviews.text: This one has great glass lenses, and the bright little removable light is a bonus. My issue with other magni visors is either weight on the nose bridge or round plastic gears to tighten the head band that wont hold tight during wear. This one has a clip that will hold it where ever you tighten it to and wont loosen while it is on so it doesn't need and doesnt have a nose rest. Plenty of flexibility on the light, lenses and headband. best of 3 that I have purchased. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Wenis

customer_reviews.title: The light sucks
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could have bought a version without the light, but at least it is removable and there is a plastic piece to insert in place of the light (which I was not aware of). I have no problems wearing this for hours if needed. I actually can combine this with my bifocals, so I can look up at my computer fine, then look down at what I am working on in finer detail. I have only used the 1.5x though so far as that is all I needed. The light is junk, but that is not what I was buying it for.
customer_reviews.author: Todd E. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Only for short usage
customer_reviews.text: The magnifying headband has an array of increasing magnification lenses (but so do the other types). The plastic that wraps around your head is hard with a slide locking device, both made of a cheap material. It is heavier than other types of similar products so wearing it became tedious while doing lashes. Lastly, the piece that lays against your forehead is also cheap, hard plastic which made my forehead sweaty and red once I removed it. Overall it does what it says but I have other, less expensive glasses that perform much better.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Florio

customer_reviews.title: Best Inexpensive Magnifier Visor
customer_reviews.text: This is, by far, the best magnifier visor that I've ever used. I especially like that my field of view isn't as limited as with most inexpensive visors. I do a lot of small inlay work and had to keep flipping my old visor up to see around my workspace. This set also flips up, but many times I can just look off to the side to find a tool or part. My wife makes jewelry and tried them on. She like them so much that I had to hide my set ! Guess I'll be ordering another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Guy

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: For this price point this is an excellent Head-Worn LED Lighted Magnifier. The magnifier lens are very helpful and the head gear is very comfortable. I bought this same item 4 years ago. Last year the light stopped working so I went back to fumbling with a flash light. Frustrated, I called Carson, the MFG, described my problem and they took down my info and said that they would send out a replacement, No Charge. So a great product with fantastic customer service at fair price
customer_reviews.author: Аmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very helpful tool for artists and crafters
customer_reviews.text: How have I painted all these years without these? I was having a hard time seeing the details on a micro model horse and. Friend reccomended this product. Suddenly I can see where to put the paint in those itty bitty eyes, and I have light too! I love that there are different magnifiers to choose from. Wearing this takes a bit of getting use too. The head adjustment may not be big enough for someone with a really big head, but it is easy to adjust for the rest of us. Now if only I could figure out a better case for this then the box.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Lenz

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, but simple design flaw lead to failure.
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice set, three different interchangeable molded acrylic lenses (each different magnification). But after several months I folded the lens over to one side (normal function) and pressed against it and both of the mounting features broke off. They are acrylic which can be brittle. A sharp internal corner where the mounting features connect to the body causes the breakage to occur with very little force. A small radius instead of sharp corner could have made them much more robust. Will look for another product next time.
customer_reviews.author: nomoslogos

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVORITE EMBROIDERY ACCESSORY
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this magnifier. I do lots of machine embroidery, when I need to remove stitches this makes it really easy to see what I am doing, lenses are crystal clear and no distortion. Included are several different strengths of lenses for use as my vision changes or even more magnification might be needed on a project. I am very happy with this purchase, wish I had done it a couple years ago. If you are thinking about purchasing this Magnivisor, buy it now and do yourself a big favor😁👍
customer_reviews.author: Speedycommander

customer_reviews.title: Too bad we can’t return it anymore nor we can use ...
customer_reviews.text: After some few usage (removing and putting another) the glass that fits in the head strap broke off. It totally didn’t serve its purpose. Too bad we can’t return it anymore nor we can use it since all the glass fittings are broken. :( but the light works well.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. C

customer_reviews.title: Glad I spent the extra $$
customer_reviews.text: Overall great for everything you need to view with precision. Was going to go with the less expensive ones but realized how much I've needed these and will use them in the future. So, I decided from the reviews these would be good for the long run. They are comfortable to wear for long periods.. like a baseball cap that you forget is on your head. You can use a secondary magnifying glass while wearing these if you need extra detail. Very satisfied with the fit and quality.
customer_reviews.author: MrFixit

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: It’s very comfortable and very crisp clear. Makes reading glasses look suboptimal. Am ordering a second one because my wife discovered them and uses them often. The best part is that we can use them while wearing prescription glasses and a part tilts up out of the way when needed to see farther out. The little light on top is useless but it doesn’t affect me since I use a bright craft LED lamp when I use these.
customer_reviews.author: Cerro

customer_reviews.title: Needs more Focal Length
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice and well designed, however I have to hold things up pretty close to see what I am looking at. I love the light and it helps see tiny details. I use these on intricate wood carvings and I build Native American Style Flutes. Tiny wood shavings in the bore, or sound holes really effect a flutes sound so I thought I would try them. I have too look, then flip them up, file or sand, then look again. Be nice if I could see while I was sanding or filing, but the focal length is too short. If they had a 20-24" focal length, I would do 5 stars because of build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Look for something else
customer_reviews.text: This thing breaks easily and is very uncomfortable to wear. Difficult to adjust the strap, and is just overall not worth the money, there has to be better products than this. I returned mine.
customer_reviews.author: Brumac

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Easy fix for headband discomfort!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Love this magnifier light combo. Several people mentioned the uncomfortable head band. The easiest fix is to find a collapsible can koozie thin foamed, cut it so you get the longest length, trim to fit, spray a little contact adhesive to the outside of koozie and a little on the headband, wait a minute or 2 and apply to headband . It is very comfortable now. Note: I disassembled the headband for this modification. Easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Cjbuck02

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for rapid coin inspection
customer_reviews.text: As a coin dealer / appraiser, I’m often in need of evaluating many coins rapidly to arrive at preliminary decisions. While the optics are not clear enough for fine-tooth grading, it works wonderfully for identification of coin basics and many varietal attributes. Optics very good and awesome for this price. Ergonomics surprisingly good. Comfort very good. Value is outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Heavy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for beadwork, but it’s going back. I found the lenses hard to remove (but fairly easy to snap in), There is a very small sweet spot for viewing, much smaller than with my eyeglasses alone, which meant I always had to turn my head to find that field of vision. But what I objected to most was the weight of the MagniVisor — it gave me a headache after about an hour. I took the headlamp with it’s three AAA batteries off and that reduced the weight a bit, but not enough. And what’s the point of having the nifty LED headlamp if I can’t focus it on my work?
customer_reviews.author: Gracie Dea

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Aid for those with Vision Difficulty
customer_reviews.text: I have the beginning of age-related macular degeneration AND I am overdue for new glasses. (Two separate issues.) I am a coloring fanatic and have been having difficulty with smaller areas to color. This solved my problem: Both the adjustable, attached light and the magnifying lenses take care of my vision problems for coloring and reading. A great investment for the money.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, works great, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We use these to paint miniatures and they are fantastic. The headband is very easily adjustable. The lenses are large which is a vast improvement over a previous model I used (different brand). The retention system for these is solid. The user can choose to flip up either the lens, or the entire front part of the visor. Definitely a plus that this brand also sells replacement lenses (in case of scratches, broken retention clips, etc) as a lot of other brands don't offer this. Can't comment on the lamp as we haven't used it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with these.
customer_reviews.text: Fine if you just need to look forward but if you need to look down the lenses flop down too.
customer_reviews.author: DebChern

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool if you do detail work.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic, but very sturdy. The four lenses are clear with little or no distortion. Snap in and out to change lenses, and they fold up if you don't need them. The light is very bright. The headband is easy to adjust. Well designed and sturdy, but lightweight. Even the box is well made for storage. The price is great. I'll buy again when these wear out....if they do.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Romero

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Both my husband and I use these. They are great for seeing tiny details both in cars/motorcycles and in jewelry making. Easy to adjust and work great! I had others that you had to change the lenses on and when we both used them we constantly had to switch lenses......not with these! We both had move the lenses to wear they work for both of us. Love how easy they are to use.
customer_reviews.author: MBR

customer_reviews.title: Lense falls out easily.
customer_reviews.text: Retaining slots for the lenses do not retain very well. Lense falls out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, brittle material
customer_reviews.text: Brittle plastic headband broke the first time I tried to use it. Actually broke while I was reading instructions, when I set it on my lap. I can't imagine it would last if you actually put it on your head!
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: nicely aligned. The only reason for not five stars ...
customer_reviews.text: I've worked with cheaper visors before but this one is well built, nicely aligned. The only reason for not five stars is the very highest power, the 3.0x, has a bit too much distortion. It may be when using it with my reading glasses, but even without I can use it, but there's some distortion and takes a bit of effort focusing my eyes to make it work. But the other sizes are great. I use it for sharpening handsaws and even on my tiny-toothed dovetail saws I don't need the 3.0x so I don't really miss it.
customer_reviews.author: TripleAM

customer_reviews.title: and versatility made this a good choice for me
customer_reviews.text: I got this visor to replace a cheaper one. The quality of construction, strength, and versatility made this a good choice for me. The light can be rotated to provide the best illumination of your work area, or removed to use as a separate flash light. There are two levels of lighting. The lenses come in a separate box with a nice wide range of magnifications. They lenses snap into position. I worried about this at first but it has not been a problem. I wear glasses and the lenses don't interfere with the glasses.
customer_reviews.author: D. Heinsohn

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: I am farsighted, and with MagniVisor I can easily read markings on smd 1205 resistors when wearing 2X lenses. However, for most cases I find 1.5X lenses are the best. I can easily solder my Arduino projects with them. I did not expect them to be that good. The build quality seems to be decent and I do not get any distortions from lenses. Finally, they are easily adjustable and stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Single bright setting,  multiple magnification
customer_reviews.text: It was working great , I've bought several brands and none have lasted as long as Carson..... until now it just failed and after a closer look I noticed the ground wire failed at the point of transition from battery compartment to the LED light adjustment stem causing the ground wire to sever . Hoping they'll honor lifetime warranty.... Outside of this Carson optical is one of the better companies. I have their mini portable telescope I use it all the time and love it ...
customer_reviews.author: Sal Farfan

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive head-mounted maginfier
customer_reviews.text: Electronics are getting smaller and my eyes aren't getting any younger. When both hands are needed for holding solder, iron, and a component, it is nice to not also juggle a magnifier. After using it off and on for a few weeks, this is doing exactly what I need. I have not installed or used the included LED lighting.
customer_reviews.author: R. Berteig

customer_reviews.title: Great for the LED, not so much for the magnifiers
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this.... the removable LED light was the best part. Sadly the magnifying lenses are on a very flexible hinge... so if you lean forward the lenses move too...this unfortunately makes any work that you need to leave stationary on a table very hard to work on while wearing these. The LED light is pretty cool though, just not worth the more than $25 unless you plan on holding your work up to your face...
customer_reviews.author: JRS

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, but is not. Broke easily. Lenses fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Clay Grove

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this was the second magnifier I ordered and the first I didn't send back. It's great that they quote the different focal lengths and magnifications on the various lenses. The Good: Easy to swap lenses Cheap Good optical quality. I assembled a set of very small circuit boards with these The Bad: The headband could be more comfortable, some padding would be nice I would buy this again
customer_reviews.author: makoman50

customer_reviews.title: Headlamp + magnifying lenses: you really can't go wrong with these optical enhancements.
customer_reviews.text: These have a nice custom-sizing headband mechanism which also has the benefit of being quick and easy to use. The headlamp is adjustable in the vertical direction and the lenses are easily swappable to accommodate the desired magnification strength. The included lens wipe is a nice touch too. I think that they're great for the price. The fact that they're exclusively made of plastic may not make them ideal for very extended periods of use (comfort issues.) But if you're that hard-core, you should already be looking at a different type of item.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Washington

customer_reviews.title: Works where devices costing 300 times as much failed.
customer_reviews.text: My Dad has macular degeneration. He couldn't read even with the aid of a high tech $10,000 device. Then he tried a $2,500 VR headset, same result/ But with this, he can read even tiny print. The bright lamp aimed at wherever he points his head helps as much as the magnification. He also uses it when looking at the computer, with the 1.5x lens and the light turned off.
customer_reviews.author: Jon P.

customer_reviews.title: very short focal distance, so you need your eyes to be really close to what are you looking at
customer_reviews.text: Two major problems with the item: 1) Lenses has very short focal distance, so you need your eyes to be really close to what are you looking at. Very uncomfortable for working. You will not be able to use them for soldering, as it is advertise in the video. 2) Clips for lenses are too tight, it could be easily broken when getting lenses out of the frame
customer_reviews.author: ilya82

customer_reviews.title: The visor is comfortable, and made well
customer_reviews.text: I am a painter by day, and an embroiderer by night. This has become invaluable to me. Often in the day at work, there are areas of low light, and not much electric available. These are invaluable, convenient and cast a soft un-glaring light. I use the lenses and light at night for close stitching. The visor is comfortable, and made well. And the lenses crystal clear, and many sizes to fit my needs. Highly recommend to anyone doing close up work.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie P.

customer_reviews.title: FITS GREAT, IT'S LIGHT WEIGHT, EASY TO ADJUST, THE LIGHT W/MAGNET WORKS GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This headset has one adjustment in the back that is super easy to adjust and stays secure. My husband uses a headset every day for work and is totally impressed and wants me to order one for him. I do a lot of sewing and the removable light will work to place on my sewing machine when I need xtra lighting or can also just stay in place to light up the area I'm working in. To be able to remove the light is 5 stars! I love it. Buy it. You won't be disappointed!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SHE SAID

customer_reviews.title: I can work on fine projects again!
customer_reviews.text: The Carson Optical Pro Series MagniVisor Deluxe was perfect. I didn't think I would use the light, but it is nice and bright. More so than those small led headlamps you can buy separately. I use the light all the time, with or without the lenses. It is very adjustable to head size, and how you can angle the lenses. It's a bit front heavy at first, but if you have the back band down lower than the forehead band, you no longer notice that. (Note: I look down while using them). I'm older and have terrible vision and I'm able to work with the smallest thread and beads with this product.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Just my husband expected.
customer_reviews.text: Carson optical Pro series MagniVisor Deluxe Head- Worn Lead Lighted Magnifier... was a birthday present for my husband. He already had this one, and he love it. He has several hobbies that require precision. He asked for it as a birthday present, to use it in our beach house. He was really happy with this gift.
customer_reviews.author: MSD

customer_reviews.title: Best product and company!
customer_reviews.text: purchased this Carson Pro Magnivsor Deluxe from Carson Optical for painting Mandala rocks, cross-stitching, and sewing. It works perfectly and helped me with extra fine work! After I had it for 2 years, the light, which can be removed, got a loose connection. I emailed the company asking if I could purchase another light. Immediately, I received an email informing me that there was no need for me to purchase another light. Instead, I was told they would mail me another at no charge to me! I have found few if any, companies with such integrity and superior customer service! This product and company are wonderful! You will be very pleased with it. Leslie Terry
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: This product adjusts easily to the size of your head
customer_reviews.text: This product adjusts easily to the size of your head, but does not have a sweat band so if worn for a while and your head sweats, it's not so comfortable. It is heavy with the batteries, so would not recommend it for long periods of use. The lenses are clear and easy to insert and take out. And works with glasses with no interference. Love the light on top of the visor it allows me to put light exactly where its needed. It is so handy for repairs, craft projects and anything involving magnification in dark areas. Plus it is really well made! I would recommend this device to anyone who fits the profile.
customer_reviews.author: EY

customer_reviews.title: Great Optical Lenses, and Visor Headband stays in place. . .
customer_reviews.text: Terrific Optical Magnifier Lenses, crisp and clear, great field of view, and they easily flip outward and upward out of my line of vision when magnification isn't required. Headband does not slip down onto my forehead when I am bent over working on project area. Purchased to remove links on three (3) ladies watches to shorten length of stainless steel bracelet bands. The adjustable headlamp is definately a bonus, eliminating shadows on the work area. Even showed my wife how to assemble this Carson Optical Pro Series MagniVisor Deluxe, so she can use it to thread needles when sewing. Currently keeping it very handy. Anticipating many future uses for this incredible vision aid tool. Highly recommend this model. . .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lenses securely held.
customer_reviews.text: The Carson Optical Pro MagniVisor provides excellent lenses. My use is for detailed scroll sawing, where my older eyes tire before I'm finished. Each of the lenses is clear acrylic, and molded perfectly. There appears to be no distortion, and the lenses look highly polished. The fit into a case that keeps them clean. A small micro-fiber cleaning cloth is included. The lenses pop in and out easily, but are secure during use. The headband is easily adjustable, and the box is sufficiently well made as to be useful for storage in my some-times dusty shop. I haven't used the LED light, as I fully light my work surfaces by other means.
customer_reviews.author: Knoble

customer_reviews.title: Where Have You Been All My Life?
customer_reviews.text: High quality optics and easily adjustable headband (I have a huge head and I wear glasses). The light is very bright too, and adjusts to shine in any direction you'd need. I've been able to do a wide range of things that I wouldn't have been able to do without the Carson Optical Pro Series MagniVisor Deluxe (from finding extremely tiny cracks in a computer circuit board on our clothes washing machine and repairing it with a soldering iron, to removing a very small fiberglass sliver from my finger). My only regret is that I didn't have this MagniVisor years ago. There are so many projects that I could've used this for.
customer_reviews.author: AMGP

customer_reviews.title: The product needs to be improved. Has fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: This visor is light and comfortable. The light is bright. The only problem is the optic lens has two prong-like extensions that inserts into two small holes and the prong that fits into the hole breaks very easily and once it breaks it will no longer hold the optic lens
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer AB

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but...
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the previous reviews. While the lenses are great, the headpiece that holds them is not. Each time I open or close the headpiece holder, the lens falls out. It has hit the floor several times, and now the lenses are getting scratched up. The holder is just inadequately engineered to hold the lenses, especially the thicker, heavier ones. I may finally glue the one I use most in place, but then I have 3 useless lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Many options
customer_reviews.text: I work on electric helicopters and cars. Eyes not real good but this device is perfect. Lots of magnification options. Completely adjustable and light is very bright. Lenses are not glass so cate needed not to a scratch them although they're durable. Serves the purpose very well.
customer_reviews.author: Gripper

customer_reviews.title: I decided to give it a good bit of use before reviewing
customer_reviews.text: I've had this setup for about a month. I decided to give it a good bit of use before reviewing. My thoughts: Lenses snap in firm. Removal is easy when the directions are followed. I like having just the lens in front of me and open field of vision around me. The LED light is bright and provides good coverage on whatever I work on. The headband has several notches, so head fitment wasn't an issue. The microfiber cloth that is included keeps the lenses free of fingerprints. Each magnification is clear and precise. I've used it working on iPhones and watches. If you have something small you're working on and it's hard to see, I recommend this visor.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: He does fine scale models
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband after the one that the VA gave him broke. He has one eye and really needs this when he’s working on fine scale models. This comes with multiple magnifying lenses and the light it really bright. My husband loves this one more than the previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Silver Star Wife

customer_reviews.title: Everyone who sees mine wants a pair- I give them as gifts!
customer_reviews.text: They are great gifts. They make taking splinters out a breeze. Getting those screws into fix eye glasses. So many things. At first my husband laughed at me and now he uses them more than me. Great for crafts and repairs.... all kinds of stuff. Adjustable strap is fast and easy and they take regular batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Sekel

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Accessory for working on small Items.
customer_reviews.text: My eyesight is not so good these days so I was looking for a hands free magnifying headset that would enable me to work on circuit boards and related items. The selection of magnifying lenses mean you have the optimal magnification for what ever job you have and the LED lamp provides that extra bit of illumination required for those difficult tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great magnifier for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The best one low priced wearable magnifier I've found on Amazon. This will come in handy when soldering and working on small items. I even used it to read small print manuals and lens #2 (low to high mag.) worked fine. The stronger the lens used the closer focal distance so I don't see how the two higher magnification lens would be usable under normal circumstances. Some type of foam on the headband would make it more comfortable and more stable but it still worked okay for me as long as I didn't move my head quickly. I may get some stick on soft foam for it though.
customer_reviews.author: JerryEl

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This purchase turned out to be better than I expected. It came in a well packaged box also. It is really easy to use and I haven't had a discomfort while wearing it. If I put it on and it begins to hurt my head, I have been able to make an adjustment to correct it. I was initially worried about how the lens come out (you have to pull it out forcibly) so take care when you are removing it. Otherwise, if you are in need of one of these, you will not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TkB

customer_reviews.title: Great magnification, painful headband
customer_reviews.text: It works, magnification quality is excellent, I love everything about it except the fact that my forehead becomes numb after wearing it for 2 hours, and I get a bruise on the back of my head caused by the buckle where the band width is adjusted. In addition to putting a band of foam across the forehead band, I've started wearing it on top of a wool watchcap that has a thick wool brim. Not so great in hot weather, but otherwise solves the problem. This would be a better product if the headband was redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: MCG

customer_reviews.title: Great for jewelry making.
customer_reviews.text: I make bead woven jewelry and use a lot of size 15/0 (~the size of a poppy seed) beads. I can see well enough without this magnifier, but eventually my eyes hurt and I have to stop. This is wonderful, and makes it so I can bead for longer periods of time. Having the light that can be positioned at the perfect angle is a huge plus. It gets a little heavy after a while, but I think this is universal with any visor style. Would have given it 5 stars had the strap been padded. I added padding myself and now it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of two

customer_reviews.title: Get Two or Three Because They Are That Handy
customer_reviews.text: Wow, for under thirty bucks I can now change all the tiny button batteries in my wife's Micky Mouse Watch collection. Fit's great, doesn't have any sore spots that leaves red welts, the lenses are a bit delicate so just don't be the Incredible Hulk when changing them. I thought the light was a dumb idea just to raise the price a bit, but it's super bright and does a great job on top of the visor or if you detach it and side light your subjects. I wish I had bought two or three so I could just leave whatever power lens on them all the time and just change head sets.
customer_reviews.author: Camster

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line, it doesn't fit my head making it un-flippable but it does have great optics.
customer_reviews.text: The visor is designed to be flipped up and down. It does when not being worn but when on my head the headband scrapes against the "flippable" part of the visor thus stopping it from being flipped up or flipped down. If there was an adequate amount of space between the headband and the visor it would be an excellent product. Word of advice, put the visor through its paces as soon as you receive it so if it doesn't work for you, you can return it within the return window. I guess I'll be selling it used in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Best I could have hoped for! Long term use has been awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Have used now for a long time, and love them! With the entire set of lens to adjust to my needs of power, the lamp, fit and comfort...all amazingly well in all regards!! Glad to have it for numerous projects I do! Won't need to replace for a long time. Oh and the case that holds the multiple lens is great to have!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Really Great.  Wish I'd purchased it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of sculpting with polymer clay and some of it involves very small fine detailing. This visor is one of the best investments I've made to supplement my craft. It's very easy to put together - just choose the magnification you desire and snap it in; then snap in the light and adjust the headband to your comfort and it's ready to go! If you're considering a magnifier along these lines for close work, this is the one to buy!
customer_reviews.author: StarCat CandyTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: Best Value Out There for Head Worn Visor
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best mangnifying head worn units out there. This is the second one I have now owned, the first one was lost, but provided years of solid use. Built well and durable and the magnifiers for small work where you really need to see is amazing. The light on top is an added bonus so I don't have to wear a separate headworn light. Adjusts tight to the head and the flip up of the lenses really comes in handy..a must have for those that need to see in close on small work.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gumby  (Tracy, CA)

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations. Nice weight, adjustment, variety of lenses with great case and cleaning cloth. Worth the expense. I use it to create pysanky eggs for close up work and even used the different lenses for a manicure and a pedicure with me ol' eyes. Just be sure to take off the lenses per the instructions on the box and remove the light fixtures carefully by pushing a pen's end through the hole on its opposite side to pop it out.
customer_reviews.author: Herstory buff

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: This is really nice. Very impressed for the price. This is clearly a hobby level product. If you sit on it, it's going to break. The lens mounting is fine but if you sit on it, the lens is going to break. If you don't use a modicum of care putting the lens in the headpiece, you're going to break a lens. I don't believe you'll be seeing these used on Grey's Anatomy any time soon but for helping out old eyes work on small things, I'm well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Yet another old guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: First the removeable magnetic light is a gift in itself. The visor is comfortable to wear. It doesn't interfere with my glasses. They are very helpful when using the scroll saw and doing intarsia works.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Great magnifying visor, well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Used this for electronics work and the different lenses were a big help. I really liked the LED light that was detachable. Be careful to make sure the lens clicks in the visor, I dropped one lense and nearly broke it.
customer_reviews.author: A500

customer_reviews.title: Great Visor. I was able to fix 3 pairs ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Visor. I was able to fix 3 pairs of headphones and also a cheap Quartz clock. The light is not so bright but bright enough to get the job done. One of the best features about the light is, you can fix the position of the beam to where you need it and it will stay in place. The visor is light in weight, also, very easy to replace the Lenses.
customer_reviews.author: I. Rosales

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.text: Love this visor! I am a beginning wooden sign maker and bought these to magnify the sign while I cut in the letters or art work. the LED light is a added plus. This light uses 3 AAA batteries and is very bright. shows your work just right. the extra lens com in a plastic box to keep them scratch free and clean I wear a size 7 5/8 and this still has plenty or room for folks with with a larger head to fit comfortably. very happy with this purchase! It makes my hobbie even more enjoyable...
customer_reviews.author: James King

customer_reviews.title: They're Decent
customer_reviews.text: These are useful for SOME projects. They give me a headache if I use them for too long, because of the grip on the headband and my eyes will start to strain as well. I find that the 2X magnifier works the best on any project. The other slides make everything harder to focus on. The light is super bright. This was a gift, but I wouldn't rush out to buy another pair if these break.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Good low cost alternative
customer_reviews.text: This was a low cost alternative to the $300 glasses for jewelry making and it is working out as well as expected. The visor is heavy with the light attached and has a tendency to slip on my head so I just remove the light most of the time. Have a high powered halogen light on my work area so rarely need that boost. I like the variety of lenses and have had no problems changing them out, although I typically stick to one. Nice to be able to wear this over my corrective lenses and get the close up for detail when I need it. And did I mention that it was less than $30?
customer_reviews.author: Teaberry12

customer_reviews.title: Great Hobby Tool
customer_reviews.text: So impressed was I with this product that I spent a few hours with it immediately after I received it to be able to write this review. Very well made with high quality packaging and a high quality product with proper instruction manual. Ideal for the hobbyist. Can be used with your regular eyeglasses, including progressives. Users need to be aware that the more powerful the magnification the shorter the focal length and the nearer the object has to be to the lens for the focus to be clear. The LED light is a great addition and significantly improved the functionality. Highly recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Selwyn Ferdinand

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work properly.
customer_reviews.text: They don't snap in tight to the Carson Optical Pro Series MagniVisor Deluxe Head-Worn LED Lighted Magnifier. When they are placed into the head unit, they are loose and will fall off if you attempt to swing the lens forward or backward. They are clear and appear to be blemish free.
customer_reviews.author: B. Carnahan

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Pulled three splinters out the day after getting ...
customer_reviews.text: Truly a Godsend! Works great! Pulled three splinters out the day after getting it and it has never been easier. Having both hands free and a clear image with a light to work with made things a snap. I pull this thing every chance I get. My wife and kids like to play with it too. Only problem so far is the 3.0 lens is not that good of an image. Seems to be blurry no matter how well you try to keep focused. So I just use the 2.5 for just about everything.
customer_reviews.author: wvaceo

customer_reviews.title: Great item for jewelry making!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for jewelry making! i have a magnifying swing are lamp but wanted something portable to take on a trip. I have ended up using it at home when I need a close up but I'm not at my workbench. The 1.5 magnification is perfect. I wish I could just make glasses out of it! The LED is super bright and very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Pam P.

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I buy this years ago? Old age and general decrepitude makes soldering tiny electronic components less 'hobby' and more 'hazard' nowadays - that was until I bought this magnifier. I noted the reviews that warned about the lenses breaking if you're not careful when fitting or removing them. I can see how that could happen, so I do take care. Otherwise, I'm very happy with how they work; they were clear with reasonable focal length, and they fit my average (I think!) head well.
customer_reviews.author: SunnySideUp

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT "Snap/Click" lens into place! -:)
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect BUT....I am unable to remove the lens right after it "clicked" into place. Fortunately I put in the correct lens so I guess I'll have to store in "as is" with the lens permanently attached to it. I dropped oil into the recess where the holder holds the lens but efforts to pull it out bends the thinner end of the holder that it might break.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: WOW - nice package. You get a lightweight (easily adjustable) headband ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW - nice package. You get a lightweight (easily adjustable) headband with LED light or a replacement blank if you don't need the light. 4 lenses and a lens cloth. Full instructions in about 4 languages. When I tried it on - with my reading glasses - it seemed not so good - so I took my glasses off and used only the visor - it was even better vision. No need for reading glasses with this unit. Its really good. For the price - I may replace my reading glasses with this :-) Best bucks I have spent in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: BINGFAN

customer_reviews.title: Really helpful for working with tiny parts!
customer_reviews.text: Really works well. I can see little printed circuit components to solder them! The only negative is that it is fairly difficult to pull a lens out and replace it. Takes a lot of pressure. I'd suggest just getting the magnification that you need and leaving it there. Oh, yes, and it also fits OVER my regular reading glasses just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Burns Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in gold
customer_reviews.text: This headset is fantastic! I do a lot of crafts, jewelry making, cross stitch, home decor and when I need extra light and a closer view, this headset does not disappoint. Not only is the headband adjustable (and comfortable as can be expected for this type of product), but you can also adjust the front piece up and down, you can swing the lens back and forth, and you can also adjust the direction of the light, or even remove it completely. This product is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no problems. For those who broke the battery flap, it’s because you need to be careful! Had this for a while now (6 months) and just changed the batteries for the first time. No problems at all!
customer_reviews.author: palabras

customer_reviews.title: Work very well
customer_reviews.text: Work very well. But, the tab that holds the lenses into place does break very easily. We have broken two of them. The light can be pivoted so it's excellent and getting it exactly where you need it. It has for magnifications which is good. We used it to examine for head lice. It worked great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Mary's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: It works for awhile!
customer_reviews.text: I like the light and the lenses but where it adjusts around your head has a plastic clip and breaks very easily. I looked online and there doesnt seem to be any replacement parts for these but I guess $35 is a throw away at this point
customer_reviews.author: 4HIM

customer_reviews.title: The Lenses come in a plastic case....the top doesn't stay closed
customer_reviews.text: Actually, for the price, this magnifier with the LES light is pretty darned good. However, at least in the one I got, the plastic case that holds the extra lenses doesn't stay closed, so the lenses often spill out. Perhaps I just got one that's not the norm.
customer_reviews.author: William S. Cherry

customer_reviews.title: WANNA SEE WHAT YOU ARE ACTUALLY DOING??
customer_reviews.text: Spend the little bit of extra money and get these! They will spoil you for working on small projects. They are crystal clear for viewing and the light helps too. Would like for a little brighter light but, it does the job. Caution though should be taken when changing lenses. They are a bit fragile. Handle with care and you won't have any issues. I use these practically every day and have become dependent on them. Makes it so much easier to see what you are working on. Highly recommend these glasses!!
customer_reviews.author: LuvDrones

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Can’t imagine doing lash extensions with out it. The light isn’t bright enough that you don’t still need a lamp, but that’s fine I don’t really use the light anyhow. But the magnification is awesome and saves my neck and my eyes!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile and functions well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent functionality and the array of different magnification lenses provide good flexibility for various applications. I work on everything from watches to detailed miniature electronic devices so this really fits my needs. The light fixture included on top of the head housing is easily adjustable for optimum illuminating of the area of interest. The light module is removable for even more placement possibilities. Construction seems to be high quality so I expect long lasting service. I'm very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan G.

product_meta.title: Carson Optical Pro Series MagniVisor Deluxe Head-Worn LED Lighted Magnifier with 4 Different Lenses (1.5X, 2X, 2.5X, 3X) (CP-60), Black, 4-Inch
product_meta.description: Style Name:MagniVisor Deluxe (CP-60)The MagniVisor Deluxe (CP-60) from the Carson PRO Series is a hands-free, head-worn magnifier included with 4 precision cut interchangeable acrylic lenses: 1.5x, 2x, 2.5x and 3x power magnifications. Once clipped onto the headset, the lenses can extend up to about an 85 degree angle if they are not needed for magnification. The MagniVisor Deluxe includes an adjustable headband with a quick release button which allows for smooth and easy adjustments for different head sizes. The LED lighted lamp (3 super bright lights) adjusts to about 30 degrees to right or left and about 90 degrees up and down to allow for adjustable lighting exposures. The LED lamp can also be used as a removable, free-standing light source as it contains a magnetic base. The LED lights are powered by 3 AAA batteries (not included). The MagniVisor Deluxe head visor magnifier is perfect for all hobbies, crafts, reading books, magazines, newspapers, model building, jewelry design and other low vision tasks! It is a great option for jewelers, coin and stamp collectors, hobbyists, watch makers, small electronics, arts & crafts, sewing, knitting, auto mechanics, soldering, seamstresses along with so many other low vision needs. The MagniVisor is lightweight, comfortable and has an ergonomic design. It can be used to fit along with reading glasses as well. The MagniVisor Deluxe is backed by Carson’s limited lifetime warranty. At Carson, we strive to make sure our customers are 100% satisfied with the quality of our magnifiers. We are so confident in our magnifiers that we back them with a Lifetime Limited Warranty! Carson will repair or replace your magnifier if it is found to have manufacturing defects in materials or workmanship. Please contact Carson for additional warranty details.

Removable LED Lamp has a magnetic base that can be used as a free standing light source | Runs on 3 AAA batteries (not included)

Lightweight and comfortable hands free head worn visor magnifier for everyday use | Great for hobbyists, arts and crafts, jewelry design, model building, reading, inspection and other low vision tasks.
Adjustable headband features a quick release button allowing for smooth and easy adjustments for different head sizes | Backed by Carson's lifetime limited warranty
